Documentation: github.com/johnstarich/env2config 

     1  package env2config
     2  
     3  import (
     4  	"sort"
     5  	"strconv"
     6  	"strings"
     7  )
     8  
     9  const (
    10  	keySeparator    = '.'
    11  	keySeparatorStr = string(keySeparator)
    12  )
    13  
    14  // parseKeyPath splits 'key' by '.' and returns the paths. Skips over escapes like '\.'.
    15  func parseKeyPath(key string) []string {
    16  	cursor := 0
    17  	var paths []string
    18  	for ix, r := range key {
    19  		if r == keySeparator && (ix == 0 || key[ix-1] != '\\') {
    20  			paths = append(paths, unescapeKey(key[cursor:ix]))
    21  			cursor = ix + 1
    22  		}
    23  	}
    24  	if cursor < len(key) {
    25  		paths = append(paths, unescapeKey(key[cursor:]))
    26  	}
    27  	return paths
    28  }
    29  
    30  func unescapeKey(key string) string {
    31  	return strings.Replace(key, `\.`, keySeparatorStr, -1)
    32  }
    33  
    34  func escapeKey(key string) string {
    35  	return strings.Replace(key, keySeparatorStr, `\.`, -1)
    36  }
    37  
    38  func deleteKeyPath(v interface{}, keyPath []string) (newValue interface{}, deleteMe bool) {
    39  	if len(keyPath) == 0 {
    40  		return nil, true
    41  	}
    42  	key := keyPath[0]
    43  	nextKeyPath := keyPath[1:]
    44  	switch v := v.(type) {
    45  	case map[string]interface{}:
    46  		newVal, shouldDelete := deleteKeyPath(v[key], nextKeyPath)
    47  		v[key] = newVal
    48  		if shouldDelete {
    49  			delete(v, key)
    50  		}
    51  		return v, false
    52  	case []interface{}:
    53  		keyInt, err := strconv.ParseUint(key, 10, 64)
    54  		if err != nil || keyInt >= uint64(len(v)) {
    55  			return v, false
    56  		}
    57  		newVal, shouldDelete := deleteKeyPath(v[keyInt], nextKeyPath)
    58  		v[keyInt] = newVal
    59  		if shouldDelete {
    60  			v = append(v[:keyInt], v[keyInt+1:]...)
    61  		}
    62  		return v, false
    63  	default:
    64  		return v, false
    65  	}
    66  }
    67  
    68  // sortTemplateDeleteKeys sorts keys so that they can all be honored correctly.
    69  // Edge cases come into play when deleting array elements, since the indexes change.
    70  func sortTemplateDeleteKeys(deleteKeys []string) {
    71  	keyPaths := make(map[string][]string)
    72  	possibleIndexes := make(map[string]uint64)
    73  	for _, deleteKey := range deleteKeys {
    74  		keys := parseKeyPath(deleteKey)
    75  		keyPaths[deleteKey] = keys
    76  		keyStr := ""
    77  		for _, key := range keys {
    78  			keyStr += escapeKey(key) + keySeparatorStr
    79  			possibleIndex, _ := strconv.ParseUint(key, 10, 64)
    80  			possibleIndexes[keyStr] = possibleIndex
    81  		}
    82  	}
    83  
    84  	sort.Slice(deleteKeys, func(a, b int) bool {
    85  		keyA, keyB := deleteKeys[a], deleteKeys[b]
    86  		pathA, pathB := keyPaths[keyA], keyPaths[keyB]
    87  		if len(pathA) != len(pathB) {
    88  			return len(pathA) > len(pathB) // (1) delete the longest paths first
    89  		}
    90  
    91  		keyStrA, keyStrB := "", ""
    92  		for ix := range pathA {
    93  			keyStrA += escapeKey(pathA[ix]) + keySeparatorStr
    94  			keyStrB += escapeKey(pathB[ix]) + keySeparatorStr
    95  			possibleIndexA, possibleIndexB := possibleIndexes[keyStrA], possibleIndexes[keyStrB]
    96  			if possibleIndexA != possibleIndexB {
    97  				return possibleIndexA > possibleIndexB // (2) then delete biggest index
    98  			}
    99  		}
   100  		return false // (3) if no key path segments differed, no need to sort further
   101  	})
   102  }
   103
